sexpression.lexer

Class Lexer

  • java.lang.Object
    • sexpression.lexer.Lexer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ILexer

    public class Lexer
extends java.lang.Object
implements ILexer
    This class takes any input stream and scans for the following tokens:
    colon (':')
    open paren ('(')
    close paren (')')
    words dileneated by either whitespace or one of the above tokens.

    • Method Detail

      • peek

        public Token peek()
        Description copied from interface: ILexer
        Peek at the next token that the next call to read will return. Calling this method does not consume a token from the stream.
        Specified by:
        peek in interface ILexer
        Returns:
        This method returns the token that the next call to read will return.
        See Also:
        ILexer.peek()

      • read

        public Token read()
        Description copied from interface: ILexer
        Consume and return the next token from the stream.
        Specified by:
        read in interface ILexer
        Returns:
        This method returns the next token that is available on the stream. If no more tokens are available, this method returns EOF.SINGLETON.
        See Also:
        ILexer.read()

      • add

        public void add(Token t)
        Add a token to the queue of tokens that have been scanned. This method should be called by state instances.
        Parameters:
        t - This is the token that was encountered and should be added to the queue.

      • setState

        public void setState(ILexerState newstate)
        Set the state of the lexer.
        Parameters:
        newstate - This is the lexer state instance that will become the lexer's new state.
